title: Blokes and sheds - Mick
creator_contributor_role: South Australian Film Corporation, production company
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Australia - Social life and customs
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Immigrants - Australia
abstract: One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia
description: One of 12 minidocos about blokes and their sheds in South Australia. Mick’s obsession with trains began when he was a young boy growing up in Prague.  He began constructing his model train world for his grandchildren many years ago. However, when they grew up and lost interest, Mick’s interest continued to grow. Mick’s shed contains another world. In it are miniature houses, people, trees and animals, all set around a train line with a “Swiss” alpine backdrop complete with snow capped mountains. Mick spends his time in his shed perfecting his miniature world and making continuous repairs, additions and alterations. Based on the book by Mark Thomson.
